dmca.title: Breach of copyright
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

 

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

 

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

 

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal
<http://www.theplanet.com/legal> .

 

Legal Response Team

THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.


________________________________

From: Asa Butcher [mailto:asa@chameleonproject.net] 
Posted At: Tuesday, September 05, 2006 12:37 PM
Posted To: Legal Response
Conversation: FW: Breach of copyright
Subject: Re: FW: Breach of copyright


5 Sept, 2006
Dear Sir/Madam,

What do you mean it doesn't 'substantially comply with the required
notification elements'? You admit that it meets some of the criteria and
it most certainly breaks many other international copyright agreements
other than the DMCA.

What does a site have to do to warrant attention? The site uses
virtually the same name as us and has ALL of our archived material, plus
logo. The site even uses our full names on the front page! If that is
not a 'substantive merit' then what is?

We are an online magazine, which means that we have responsibility to
our contributors to protect their Intellectual Rights and a site such as
this is the antithesis of what we stand for.

Asa Butcher


We cover every issue...every day
www.ovimagazine.com


Legal Response wrote: 

        To Whom It May Concern:

        

        Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice
does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of
the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

        

        Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of
your claim.

        

        Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal
<http://www.theplanet.com/legal> .

        

        Legal Response Team

        THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.


________________________________

        From: Asa Butcher [mailto:asa@chameleonproject.net] 
        Posted At: Tuesday, September 05, 2006 7:32 AM
        Posted To: Legal Response
        Conversation: Breach of copyright
        Subject: Breach of copyright
        
        
        5 Sept, 2006
        Dear Sir/Madam,
        
        It has come to our notice that one of your customers
(www.playarta.com, www.wexico.com, www.oviwebdevelopment) has recently
used the domain: www.theovimagazine.com to host material to which he has
no legal right or jurisdiction.
        
        The site carries articles, illustrations, cartoons and other
material that are all copyrighted and he has no permission to use. The
origin of all of this material is from a similarly named site:
www.ovimagazine.com.
        
        According to your Terms of Service, the domain is breaching a
number of international copyright laws:
        
        Intellectual Property Infringement Policy 

        Customers may not transmit, distribute, download, copy, cache,
host, or otherwise store on a Server any information, data, material, or
work that infringes the intellectual property rights of others. The
Planet has the right to disable access to, or remove, infringing content
to the extent required under any law or regulation, including the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998.

        The Planet reserves the right to suspend permanently or
terminate the Services of any Customer that repeatedly violates The
Planet's Intellectual Property Infringement Policy or any copyright law.


        Please advise our magazine of the situation.
        
        Mr Asa Butcher
        -- 
        
        We cover every issue...every day
        www.ovimagazine.com
